snippet: John E. Bryson announced that he would undergo tests and evaluation and that Deputy Secretary Rebecca M. Blank would assume his duties.
abstract: Commerce Secretary John E Bryson takes medical leave after passing out at the wheel and causing two hit-and-run car crashes in Los Angeles County; White House says that Bryson had suffered a seizure and will undergo tests and evaluation; Deputy Secretary Rebecca M Blank will assume his duties during that time.

byline.original: By ADAM NAGOURNEY and HELENE COOPER
byline.contributor: Adam Nagourney reported from Los Angeles, and Helene Cooper from Washington. Reporting was contributed by Jennifer Medina from Los Angeles; Ian Lovett from San Gabriel, Calif.; Ana Facio-Krajcer from San Marino, Calif.; and Michael D. Shear from Washington.

lead_paragraph: John E. Bryson announced that he would undergo tests and evaluation and that Deputy Secretary Rebecca M. Blank would assume his duties.

headline.seo: Commerce Secretary Bryson Takes Medical Leave After Hit-and-Run Crash
headline.main: Commerce Secretary Takes Medical Leave After Hit-and-Run Crash
headline.print_headline: Commerce Secretary Takes Medical Leave After Hit-and-Run Crash
